methods.void add(E e): Inserts the specified element into the list (optional operation).
methods.boolean hasNext(): Returns true if this list iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the forward direction.
methods.boolean hasPrevious(): Returns true if this list iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the reverse direction.
methods.E next(): Returns the next element in the list and advances the cursor position.
methods.int nextIndex(): Returns the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to next().
methods.E previous(): Returns the previous element in the list and moves the cursor position backwards.
methods.int previousIndex(): Returns the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to previous().
methods.void remove(): Removes from the list the last element that was returned by next() or previous() (optional operation).
methods.void set(E e): Replaces the last element returned by next() or previous() with the specified element (optional operation).
